Reviews.Title: “Best price and location”
Reviews.Author: BalaBrussels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located (walkable from Rly station) to party area including RLD. You step out and you get everything you want. Sight-seeing are close by and walkable. Prices are amazing. They even accomodated me to the hotel next to it when they realized that they over booked. Rooms are pretty normal with good heating system. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CIRA
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC LOCATION!!!!its about 50m fro RLD,and its in the city centre,a Dam sq. is a minut away,sexmuseum a minut,many famous coffee shops are around the hotel(route66,grashoper,...),there are sex shops,fast food,and nice caffee bars(like hot or not :) ,there are alow smoking cigarets)...rooms are clean and small and cheap...if you going to amsterdam for fun,drugs and prostitutions this is the perfect hotel....oh,yes...the central station is about 100m from hotel :) great!!! i was 3days in decembar...forget the hotel and how its look...its location that you need in amsterdam...ofcourse if you like only to visit museum's here,then dont stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: Location great, rooms clean, old fashioned, but clean. Cheap stay in a great city

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: DaveIoW24
Reviews.Content: Central located clean very basic hotel had to pay a depoist for the key tho,

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location I loved it”
Reviews.Author: twinkles
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here to visit coffee shops. This place was perfect. Out my window were the neon lights of a coffee shop. It was warm enough to sleep with the windows open so I could here the party scene down below. It is a fire trap. As I meandered up spiral staircases and around corners and even up three steps, down three steps, I realized if there was a fire, I was a goner. All this might sound horrible to you, but as I sat in my room smoking myself to sleep, I could imagine a "William Hurt kind of character" sitting in my room. I thought it was great and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and a bit dodgy but clean”
Reviews.Author: StefanieMendez
Reviews.Content: Stayed in last weekend (July 2011). Paid 70 euros for a double bed for 2 nights, plus 10 deposit for the key. The guy on reception seemed nice enough. The room was tiny but we weren't expecting a mansion! The en suit was clean enough although the bathroom lock was dodgy and the shower curtain was too short, making the floor wet! Room wasn't cleaned during our stay, a man just came round to ask to empty our bin. Single glazing so it's quite loud at night but we both managed to drift off to sleep ok. You can hear the church bells which is nice to wake up to. Great location, in the centre of the Nieuwe Zijde so close to train station, red light district etc. Not too sure about the safety though, there's a lock on the door up to the rooms which is controlled by the guy on reception. However, we came back one night to find a drug dealer walking out of that door, who then offered us and other guests drugs right in front of the staff! The staff said nothing to him. Don't think it's great that the staff let drug dealers roam around the corridors to rooms. On the last day you will be woken up before 10am by a guy asking for your key back and giving you your 10 euros back, a bit of an unconventional way to check up but he seemed pleasant! We had a late flight back so considered leaving our bags behind reception, but after seeing the dealer we decided to put them in a locker at Centraal. Also we found drugs hidden in our radiator. But depending on why you're in Amsterdam, you might like this or dislike this!

Reviews.Title: “this was the worst hotel i have ever been”
Reviews.Author: iou79
Reviews.Content: there was the smallest room (double bed) I have ever seen about 4-5 m2. The triple rooms were bigger I would not suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: company45
Reviews.Content: Me and 4 mates in one room NOT much room. The hotel was basic, value for money, can't complain due to location, rooms clean first day, customer service OK. Steep stairs. Would stay again if i needed to use a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms with very steep steps but clean rooms and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AusTravelGirl_11
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel before reading reviews here and was a little nervous but it was exactly what we wanted - somewhere clean and in great location. Nothing at all fancy but it doesn't pretend to be.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dugstar0 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent position for everything, we booked a triple ensuit and it was big enough for 3 very dated, clean when we first arrived but not cleaned during our 4 days, only real bad point was the stairs we were on the top floor and we had to walk up about 5 flights of very steep stairs. Overall for Â£60 a night for a triple room I would recommend unless your a couple.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: NottsChi Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel is very basic and could do with some moderization, but very clean (staff done the room everyday). staff were helpful if you needed anything, reception manned 24hrs just incase of a problem. couldnt ask for anymore central location close to EVERYTHING! overall excellent value for the money. would defo stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BunnyP777
Reviews.Content: Before travelling to Amsterdam I'd read many reviews about this hotel - some bad and some good so went with an open mind. If you are looking for a place to rest your head for the evening that is right in the centre of Amsterdm, then this is the place for you. I won't lie - It is basic and the rooms are small but it is so clean and the staff are very friendly. Couple of things... on arrival you need to leave a â‚¬10 deposit for your room key (you get this back when you check out) which we weren't aware of and the steps to the rooms are very very steep. There is no lift but its not really an issue unless you've got heavy bags!! The hotel is at most a 5 minute walk from central station, 5-10 minutes to dam square and literally round the corner from all the Amsterdam night life you could possibly want! All in all - a great place to stay, would hightly recommed it and would definately stay there again :-)

Reviews.Title: “very basic one night only”
Reviews.Author: UkBigrich
Reviews.Content: Well i picked this hotel for my last night to be close to the red light district in Amsterdam.I got what i expected from a budget hotel it was ok as i just wanted a place to sleep for 4 or 5 hours on my last night before travel in the morning.There was alot of steep stairs which is the norm for most places in the town.There was nothing in the room apart from a bed so if you want a basic place to sleep its ok.The reception staff was friendly even though he had some grief of people smoking setting his alarms off quite a few times lol.I paid 50 euro for the one night which i think is alot for what you get there.I would stay again but only for the same purpose to be close to the action for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Ultra-One
Reviews.Content: I booked a different hotel through hoteliers.com but the hotel was never informed of my booking so i only managed to stay there one night. I checked out on a Friday morning and this was the only "Hotel" i managed to find that had a spare room in the area around Warmoerstraat which is very close to the Central Train Station. I was given a room on the top floor (5th) and i had to carry my 30kg suitcase by the very narrow and steep stairs as there is no lift which took me 15min or more! The room measured around 2x2.5m and only had a sink and a double bed with an old blanket (not even a quilt) and they did not at least have any glasses or cups for you to drink water, but you had to drink straight from the tap. The shower (which in it's merit had hot water 24h) and toilets were in the corridor and were shared with other rooms but this is also the case in many hotels in Amsterdam. The heating was not working at all (only in this room), and the temperature inside the room was around 14 to 15C at night which is cold enough for you to shiver! I had to wear my winter coat whenever i was in the room! It was one of the worst experiences of my life, and for 70E a day (Friday and Saturday) it is definitely a rip-off. Stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love Hotel Buersstraat.”
Reviews.Author: badger_rnr
Reviews.Content: Okay I've read some reviews and I have to say my piece, I've stayed there 4 times and never once could I complain about my stay, If your looking for a nice Hotel then this place is NOT for you, But if your in Amsterdam to party then this place is great 24 hour reception with friendly staff who I now know by name, Location is unbeatable, Warmoestraat and RLD are within 3 minute walk as is a central police station. All in all its worth the cheap price tag which varies on lenght of stay and time of week. I definitely recomend this place if your not the fussy type, It has its very own quirky atmosphere and vibe around the place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the last of it's kind - we like it :-)”
Reviews.Author: J0hn55555
Reviews.Content: Well...describing Hotel Beursstraat is not as easy as the rest. It is... well a good old fasioned straight to the point place to periodically rest ,while checking out Amsterdam out life. The double rooms are extremely simple: two beds and a night-table; thats it for furniture. And you can just walk in between the beds. There is a shower, a sink and toilet. The basics. We find the hotel to reflect its location somehow; the pulsating Amsterdam Red Light district :-) and has something romantic about it's atmosphere... We stay there quite often and the price varies between 60 euros on weekdays to 70 euros in the weekends. ...if you are a light sleeper the partying people on the streets will share their good times till 3 am... so no problem if you are one of them. It seems as if the staff has a pretty good control of inside the hotel though...it's pretty quiet even though the walls do not offer much sound isolation. If you stay some days they will change the sheets and empty the rubbish every day, it is hygenic enough but not super clean. The staff is friendly enough and we feel safe staying there. To "feel" the Red light district atmosphere it is good. The stairs are steep though and if you stay on one of trhe top floors you will propably sweat if you have a lot of luggage. There is nothing else to buy or consume in this hotel, although it does have a pay phone for coins in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “absolute filth”
Reviews.Author: pioneercdj
Reviews.Content: Worst state of a hotel ever, rooms are tiny no window in bath room shower is no good over flows when used, RATS in the room i was in jumped on my bed and off it.. seriously unhealthy stay thrown ourt at half 10 no hotel service four beds like match boxes.. its like a mental home, made my stay at the dam a waste of time and we had 5 ppl but only gave 4 beds

Reviews.Title: “Good location - awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cantona1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Essentially you get what you pay for. Having said that I have stayed in hostels (Kabul down the road) that were better than this. Location wise excellent, try the Frisco next door as a much better option. The best bit is when they chuck you out of your room at 10:15am.

Reviews.Title: “The facade is good BUT it's like an impaired boarding house inside”
Reviews.Author: mybruce
Reviews.Content: This is Ed from London England. We went there in December 2008. We were happy to see the facade but when we went to our room it's the opposite of the facade which is like a dilapidated building. I will not call the place a hotel. Nasty smell, no lift and the white bed sheets are greyish. The place is good to sleep after a tiring day of touring around Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A hostel not a hotel but fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: f_i_o_n_a_86
Reviews.Content: This was more of a hostel than a hotel. Our room was 4 or 5 floors up very steep stairs. The walls were paper thin and there were lots of other young and loud people everywhere. Having said that the room was clean and the location was superb. Could do with updating, think our room and sheets were from the 70s. A bit steep price for what it was but great for young people who arent too fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & central for happy days in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kez556
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel i had to come back and leave one of my own. we arrived in Amsterdam at 10am it took us 10 minutes to find the hotel and we were allowed to check in early great. Yes the rooms are a bit dated and there is that smell of cannabis in the air but hey your in the dam. overall the rooms were clean, warm and with a 24 hour reception its everything you need for a great base to explore this fantastic city, you are literally with in 5 minute walking distance to everything.The Grasshopper is four doors away. The staff were really helpful they even wake you up an hour and a half before check out time also as we had a late flight home they allowed us to leave our bags in the office until later in the day. The only downside for us were the stairs very steep and windy but again this is just one of the quirky things about all places in Amsterdam I would absolutely recommend this hotel it does what is says cheap and central great for happy days in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - clean but not cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Neats1966
Reviews.Content: The location of the Beursstraat is fabulous it is situated one street behind the start of the RLD, within seconds of leaving the hotel you are in the heart of the RLD. But it really is a budget hotel, and not a hotel to have any expectations of! If you are not bothered where you stay or what you stay in and just want to get your head down for the night then the beursstraat will just about be okay! & despite some of the earlier reviews I did not see any vermin, or get bitten. I have listed what I consider to be the good and bad points of the hotel and hope these will help anyone decide whether or not the Beursstaat is for them! Good points !! 1) Clean sheets, pillow case, shower and toilet. 2) Can leave luggage after check out, until departure time. 3) 24 hour reception 4) Location 5) Cost - Â£44 for one night - 2 people 6) Pleasant & helpful reception staff. Not so good points!!! 1) Hotel possibly on par with a hostel. 2) Rooms shabby & run down 3) Only enough hot water for one person to shower, soon runs cold 4) No heating in rooms, I was so cold I had to sleep in jeans and jumper! 5) Rooms and landing areas stink of dope and tobacco. 6) Blankets/Bed throws - I doubt have been washed for years. 7) Towels provided - 2 face towels, clean but well worn and tatty. 8) Some "nice" person coughing and clearing their throat excessively early in the morning and spitting out of their bedroom window!!!!! (doubt you'd get that at the ritz!) I certainly wouldnt want to pay a lot of money for a one night stay, after all it is only a bed for the night, but you do get what you pay for and personally I wish I'd paid that little bit more, I am sure had I done so the whole experience would have been much nicer. I wouldnt stay at the beurstraat again, I'd much sooner pay an extra Â£30/Â£40 and stay somewhere a bit nicer. My sister stayed at the Hoksbergen hotel, just off dam square (about a 5 min walk), she paid just over Â£70 for the one night and in comparison although still very basic it was nicer, perhaps not worth Â£70 but having toured her hotel and room, it was considered a much more comfortable environment! Breakfast provided was apparently basic but okay. Like the Beurstraat though, the shower in her hotel soon ran cold and only sufficient for one person to shower, leaving her all soaped up and having to rinse off in cold water! But if I had to choose out of the two hotels I would much prefer to stay at the Hoksbergen.

Reviews.Title: “Once again A1!”
Reviews.Author: Mrwurzal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beursstraat, as you can see from my last review is fantastic! My partner and I stayed here once again for our short break stay in the city, we love this hotel for a number of reasons first being the location, as it is right smack bang in the centre of all the action, when i say right in the centre of all the action, it is at the back of the Red light district, and 4 buildings away from the famous Grasshopper, safety wise its good as you are only 2 doors away from the local police station! (not that you would need it!!) The 2nd reason that we love this hotel is the price, it is really cheap and a good standard for the price, i know there are a lot of reviews saying that the hotel is dirty and uncomfortable. This hotel is not one to take your nan, mother or anyone that would be fussy in which they stay, i mean the best way to explain it, if you are used to staying at the Hilton hotels ot the marriot PLEASE DONT BOOK HERE! This really is a budget hotel with literally one bed (or 2 if you have a twin of course) and a toilet with shower and of course a toilet!) The hotel itself, hosts a staircase in which is much better in design than most others in the city, if you have stayed at some of the other budget hotels in the area, you will know that by design, the stairs are usually quite steep and quite difficult to master, but the updated stairs here are not too difficult, but are steeper than most british homes stairs. The rooms are clean tidy and comfortable, the only thing that would and could possibly annoy you at this hotel is the bells that seem to chime up until 12 midnight and start again at what i believe to be 6am, once you get used to them its not really an issue and if you have sampled a lot of the local delicatessans you will find that this wouldnt really affect you! The hotel staff are friendly, and will help you in any way they can, and will always give you a friendly greeting when entering or leaving the hotel, they even gave us a knock to make sure we was up on the day of us leaving to cath our plane ( i think this was to make sure we was out of our room at the check out time of 10.30 mind you!!) The hotel itself is very secure and has a buzzer door so that the hotel reception staff let you in at each time you enter the hotel so security wise it is very good. There is a deposit you have to give upon entering the hotel for the first time, which is 10 euro's which is a refundable deposit for you key, which once you check out you get back which is quite usefull as i always use this if i have spent out to get the train home! If you were tinking of staying at this hotel i would ask you the following questions: 1: Do you want basic but comfortable accomodation? 2: Do you want to be close to the centre of the city? If you have answered yes to the above questions then you will be well suited to this hotel, go for it, dont expect glitz and glamour, you need to expect basic and comfotable! Go the the Dam, go and see the sights and enjoy your stay, dont complain that its not as good as when you last stayed at the Hilton! Enjoy.... Dan

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: Hannzie
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in Hotel Beursstraat for a total of three nights, and found it did exactly what it said on the tin. We asked for a cheap hotel, and that's what we got, so can't really complain. The room wasn't very big, it consisted of a double bed, and about a foot's space around the bed, and a small room with a bathroom. It was a bit dingy, but we wern't expecting much. The people on recepotion were very helpful, and let us leave our bags in holding on the last day as our flight wasn't until a few hours after check-out. The hotel has a very good location, about one street away from the main strip of the Red-Light district, so central but not too central. Also a short walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: RPR2007
Reviews.Content: I canÂ´t understand the lousy reviews. What to expect for a one-star-hotel? ItÂ´s perfectly located, itÂ´s cheap and itÂ´s clean. The towels are indeed to small, but we did bring our own. Who cares if the rooms are ugly? If you go to Amsterdam to stay in a hotelroom - choose another town! I can highly rekommend to stay on Beursstraat for anyone who likes to travel for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected....”
Reviews.Author: QueenLizard
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Beursstraat for three nights with my three friends and it was actually quite good. I read really bad reviews of the place and I was upset before getting there but, when I arrived, it was actually not has bad as I thought it would beâ€¦ I mean, you only shouldnâ€™t expect more of what you pay for and it wasnâ€™t bad at allâ€¦ The receptionists were nice and helpful. The hotel is very basic but clean and handyâ€¦ Better than a hostel, at least you donâ€™t have to share with Tom, Dick and Harryâ€¦Location was perfect and, of course it smelled of â€˜natural drugsâ€™ but God! Itâ€™s Amsterdam!!!â€¦ I would definitely recommend it but only to not very fuzzy people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: travellingmancunians
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 07 booked via Internet. The rooms are basic and pillows are a tad lumpy not to mention the stairs are similar to the summit of everest (no lift), but hey its cheap, has plenty of charachter and most importantly is well located. Its a lively area with all the coffee shops, bars, red light district, central station within a few steps from the hotel. Worth getting a day pass from central station to jump on/off metro which is cheap and stops at all the main sights and v cheap. If you want luxury look eleswhere but if you need a place to stay for a couple of days and are on a budget its an ideal base, hot showers and rooms clean although v small. Had a great short break here and the sun was shining... Enjoy !!!! Nikki + Neil G - Manchester

Reviews.Title: “Central location but very, Very basic!”
Reviews.Author: Jonnie77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good central location backing on to the red light district and a stones throw from centraal station and the rest of the sights and sounds of Amsterdam. Its a very basic hotel no frills, facilities or extras, the rooms are tiny and the ensuite even more so. You are provided with 2 tiny towels and thats about it. There is no storage or hanging space for anything!! You have to navigate some very narrow and steep stairs to get to your rooms. You do leave a key deposit of 10 euros but this is given back upon checking out which is by 10.30a.m. They will happily store your luggage for you in a room if you have a later flight, train etc at no extra cost. Amsterdam itself is an excellent city break, easy to get around, public transport second to none and plenty to see and do, the red light district is certainly an eye opener and worth a walk through both day and night. Drinks can vary in price depending on bar a vodka and coke cost from 5 euros to 9.5 euros so worth checking out the prices. Summing up, the hotel is clean in an excellent location but lacks any extras best suited to those on a strict budget or who just wanna bed for the night. Defo not for anyone who likes their creature comforts

Reviews.Title: “Refused to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda+Jaime
Reviews.Content: With expectations of a simple hotel with a bed and bathroom just to basically sleep in, after 10 minutes we had organised alternative accomodation. As two young Australian girls just touring around Europe we didn't expect much on our budget. we were greeted by the desk staff who found the cartoon on the tv a much higher priority then us arriving to book in. We were treated as though we were more of an inconvenience especially considering we had booked online, and were then ordered (not asked) to pay a deposit for the key. As we walked up the stairs we still remained optimistic that this hotel would be quaint but safe. However, once opening the door to our room we immediately felt unsafe. There was a stale smell coming from the bathroom and the smell of dope was overpowering. (which is expected in Amsterdam but a simple open window could have prevented this) UNTIL we opened the window. we realised that our window opened on to what we think is the roof of the reception below, as did the room across from us. Which we in fact could have walked straight into, hence we felt even more unsafe. We proceeded to actually open the bathroom door to try and air the room. Only to realise that part of the smell was caused by the fact that the toilet had not been flushed. Without sounding like a princess, the smell was so bad that we felt immediately ill. Moving on to the beds, we had a twin room, which meant two tiny beds. They looked dirty, uncomfortable and one of them actually leant against the heater. At the end overall I would never recommend this hotel and have actually made this comment to try and stop other people being put in the same predicament as we were. All I can say is be careful when booking online.

Reviews.Title: “it is what it says on the packet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a party of five just looking for a 'base'. We came across this hotel and the bloke that manned the reception said its just clean and simple and did not offer overpriced extras i.e television, breakfast etc. Very clean and manned 24hrs. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Light”
Reviews.Author: geebee7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and found it ok if you are only staying for a couple of nights. The staff were friendly enough and the location is very central ( 5 minute walk from central station ). There is no lift in the hotel so be prepared for a hike up the staircases which we likened to a climb up the North face of the Eiger only difference is the north face of the eiger was easier to climb.

Reviews.Title: “READ BEFORE YOU BOOK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not suitable to anyone who is not stonned. the rooms are cramped and you need to learn to sleep standing up as the beds are a torture device!!advisable not to bring any clothes as there is nowhere to hang or store clothing. dont worry about an alarm call as the nearby church clock will wake you every hour on the hour. if you even think about a shower you need to be under 3" tall as the towel provided will struggle with anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Good”
Reviews.Author: hannigan007
Reviews.Content: Came in on the train from Schipol and didnt have to walk too far from the central station to the hotel. The people who work in the reception are very helpful and friendly. There are loads of rooms in this hotel but if your staying in any room above number 10 you`ll have to walk up numerous staircases and will be absolutely nackered tired by the time you reach your room. The rooms itself are really really really basic and lacking "modern amenities" such as a tv. The beds are comfortable but resemble a cardboard box with a matrass ontop. The toilets are spotless and the showers are lovely and warm which is a big plus. The walls in the rooms are paper this though so you might hear goings on in other rooms or people in other rooms might hear your goings on :). Alot of people said its hard to sleep here at night but I slept no problem and was at the front of the hotel, just close the windows and ye will be grand lads. On the plus its really centrally located and the street behind the hotel is chock full of really good bars, clubs, shops, restaurants, coffee shops and everything else Amsterdam is about. Really close to the red light district too. Definately dont stay here if you have a family or kids with you but if your only going to use it as a base for your excursions into the craziness of Amsterdam I`d recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, center ... I will not go back”
Reviews.Author: carmela71
Reviews.Content: The rooms that overlook to the red distric will be noisy till 4.00 then at 6.00 the bin lorrys and by 7.00 the bells of the church .... so you need a few beers to get to cleep there... The rooms that ovelook to the other side were less noisy, but the bell was there every 15 minutes from 7.00 Price for for a central room was ok, the rooms were not really clean, but they allowed to leave our luggage there while we were clying for three days, that was very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & cheap but clean!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First to say that i'm spanish and me and our friends was found in this hotel what we need. Only a roof to protect from rain and cold at night. And it was clean! Fantastic! And price i think 20 â‚¬ per night per person! No more problem. Near from central station and you have grass hoper door to door. A fast joint in the morning or later hours at night! The boos or the man who wor in hotell, no problem, no questions, no more... Only laught and say good day! good night! It's my hotel dream in Amsterdam! A 20 â‚¬ la noche es fantastico. Simple pero limpÃ¬o, mu limpio. BaÃ±o compartido y buenas vistas de los tejados de la ciudad. Os recomiendo ultima planta, trankilidad....(Translation per google: At 20 Euros, the night is fantastic. Simple but clean very clean. Shared bath and good views of the tile roofs of the city. I recommend to you complete ??? tranquility....)

Reviews.Title: “not serious!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i spoke with a guy from the hotel one day before arriving amsterdam. "a free 2-person-room? no problem!" and the price....55 euros. BUT...... in fact there was NO double-room free and a single room should cost something about 70 euros. we lost a half day by searching another (more expensive!) room. unserious!!

Reviews.Title: “Beursstraat Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Beursstraat for 3 nights recently and found that it suited our needs perfectly. The rooms are on the small side but are clean and functional and after all most people are only there for a few nights at a time. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a 2-4 night break at a very reasonable price. It is ideally situated for central station and makes a good base for any sightseeing that you would want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, warm but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very clean, basic but comfortable place. Rooms are very small and quite sparsely furnished but they are clean and the bed is good and the shower is hot! Great position for the hotel - 5 monutes walk from Central Station and 2 minutes from the nearest coffee shop (with an abundance more very close by)Quite noisy inside as the stairs are all wooden and the walls/doors very thin, but if you are caned enough you sleep like a baby!!! Oh and get used to the sound of church bells! Great value for just Â£20 per person per night!

Reviews.Title: “Free weed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: cheap, clean, friendly, looked out my bedroom window and found an eighth of skunk - what more could you want -oh, right on the corner of the red-light district!

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap, but value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Â£20 per night I think. Which is a bargain. (per person, i think, but it might be a 2-person room, I'm not sure) It's within walking distance of practically everywhere, including the station, and it's right next to the red light district. The rroms aren't great, but they're adequate and you get what you paid for. There's a shower and a toilet and the rooms can accommodate up to five people in single beds. The beds aren't fantastic, but they're warm and comfy. And you can smoke in your room. There's a pizza place on the Damrak, about 1 minute's walk from the hotel, and breakfast is served a few doors up from that, consisting of coffee, rolls, butter, jam and some ham and cheese. The only difficult thing about the beursstraat is the navigation. There are many windy staircases and it's really easy to get lost, especially if you've been er smoking. It's really fun though, and you'll find your room eventually, somewhat out of breath. For value for money, this hotel is fantastic, perfect for students and young people, although I'm not sure it's very suited to family accommodation. 10/10

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Beursstraat
HotelInfo.Address: Beursstraat 7, Amsterdam 1012 JT, The Netherlands
